intro: Galium saturejifolium, commonly known as silverweed, is a low-growing perennial plant native to the western United States and parts of Canada. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its prostrate or ascending stems that often form dense mats. The plant has small, opposite leaves that are typically covered in fine, silver-white hairs, giving it a distinctive appearance. Its flowers are clustered in small umbels and are usually pink or white, blooming in late spring to early summer. Galium saturejifolium is adapted to dry, rocky soils and is often found in open woodlands and grasslands.
